summary: The Australian Broadcasting Corporation (ABC) is Australia's national broadcaster, mainly funded by the government. It's independent and reports annually. Established in 1932, it was originally funded by household licenses but now gets direct government funding. Modeled after the BBC, ABC offers radio, TV, online, and mobile services across Australia. It has local radio stations, national networks, and TV channels. In every capital city, its postal address is PO Box 9994, honoring cricketer Sir Donald Bradman.
title: Australian Broadcasting Corporation
